section_id: ## Proof of Theorem 1: Invariant Measure Existence

hints.label: lem-hard-core-exclusion
hints.title: Proof Sketch of {prf:ref}`thm-invariant-measure-existence`
hints.content:
497: :::{prf:proof} Proof Sketch of {prf:ref}`thm-invariant-measure-existence`
498: 
499: **Step 1: A Priori Energy Bounds and Hard-Core Exclusion**
500: 
501: We first establish deterministic bounds on configurations with finite energy, without assuming the existence of $\mu_{\text{inv}}$.
502: 
503: :::{prf:lemma} Hard-Core Exclusion from Energy Bounds
504: :label: lem-hard-core-exclusion
505: 
506: For any energy level $E > 0$, define:
507: 
508: $$
509: r_{\min}(E) := \sqrt{\frac{A}{E + 1}}
510: 
511: $$
512: 
513: where $A$ is the repulsion strength parameter from the potential $V_{\text{pair}}(r) = A/r^2 + Br^2$.
514: 
515: Then any configuration $(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U})$ with $H(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U}) \leq E$ satisfies:
516: 
517: $$
518: \min_{i \neq j} \|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}(E)
519: 
520: $$
521: 
522: **Proof**: Suppose $\|x_i - x_j\| = r < r_{\min}(E)$ for some pair. The total energy decomposes as:
523: 
524: $$
525: H(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U}) = H_{\text{nodes}}(\mathbf{x}) + H_{\text{gauge}}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U}) \geq H_{\text{nodes}}(\mathbf{x})
526: 
527: $$
528: 
529: since $H_{\text{gauge}} \geq 0$. The node Hamiltonian is a sum of pairwise potentials:
530: 
531: $$
532: H_{\text{nodes}}(\mathbf{x}) = \sum_{i<j} V_{\text{pair}}(\|x_i - x_j\|) \geq V_{\text{pair}}(r) = \frac{A}{r^2} + Br^2 \geq \frac{A}{r^2}
533: 
534: $$
535: 
536: If $r < r_{\min}(E) = \sqrt{A/(E+1)}$, then $r^2 < A/(E+1)$, so:
537: 
538: $$
539: H \geq \frac{A}{r^2} > \frac{A}{A/(E+1)} = E + 1 > E
540: 
541: $$
542: 
543: This contradicts the assumption $H \leq E$. Therefore, all pairs must satisfy $\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}(E)$.

hints.label: lem-uniform-force-bounds
hints.title: Uniform Force Bounds
hints.content:
551: :label: lem-uniform-force-bounds
552: 
553: For any configuration satisfying the hard-core constraint $\min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}$:
554: 
555: 1. **Node forces are uniformly bounded**:
556: 
557: $$
558: \sup_{\mathbf{x} : \min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}} \|\nabla_{x_i} H_{\text{nodes}}(\mathbf{x})\| \leq C_F(N) := (N-1) \sup_{r > 0} |V'_{\text{pair}}(r)| < \infty
559: 
560: $$
561: 
562: 2. **Gauge forces are bounded for any gauge field**:
563: 
564: $$
565: \sup_{\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U} : \min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}} \|\nabla_{x_i} H_{\text{gauge}}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U})\| \leq C_G(N, N_c, \beta_{\text{gauge}}, r_{\min}) < \infty
566: 
567: $$

551: :label: lem-uniform-force-bounds
552: 
553: For any configuration satisfying the hard-core constraint $\min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}$:
554: 
555: 1. **Node forces are uniformly bounded**:
556:

558: \sup_{\mathbf{x} : \min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}} \|\nabla_{x_i} H_{\text{nodes}}(\mathbf{x})\| \leq C_F(N) := (N-1) \sup_{r > 0} |V'_{\text{pair}}(r)| < \infty
559: 
560: $$
561: 
562: 2. **Gauge forces are bounded for any gauge field**:
563: 
564: $$
565: \sup_{\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U} : \min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}} \|\nabla_{x_i} H_{\text{gauge}}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U})\| \leq C_G(N, N_c, \beta_{\text{gauge}}, r_{\min}) < \infty
566:

hints.label: lem-gauge-force-bound
hints.title: Bounded Gradient of Plaquette Weights
hints.content:
596: :label: lem-gauge-force-bound
597: 
598: For triangular plaquettes $\Delta$ in a Delaunay triangulation satisfying:
599: - Hard-core exclusion: edge lengths in $[r_{\min}, R_{\text{cut}}]$
600: - Shape regularity: aspect ratio $\rho(\Delta) \leq \rho_{\max}$, area $A(\Delta) \geq A_{\min}$
601: 
602: the gradient of the weight function $w(\Delta) = \exp(−(\rho(\Delta) − 1)^2/(2\sigma_{\text{shape}}^2))$ satisfies:
603: 
604: $$
605: \|\nabla_{x_i} w(\Delta)\| \leq C_w(\rho_{\max}, r_{\min}, R_{\text{cut}}, A_{\min}, \sigma_{\text{shape}})
606: 
607: $$
